executive_summary: The hair removal services industry has experienced significant growth driven by rising incomes and social media's influence on beauty standards. However, the industry faced challenges during the pandemic due to closures and health concerns. Pent-up demand after the pandemic led to a spike in spending in 2021. Staffing challenges, higher living costs, and the resumption of student loan payments are expected to subdue spending on pricier hair removal treatments in 2024. The industry is facing increased competition and regulatory scrutiny.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: An Expanding Hair Removal Space Confronts Competitive Pressures
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Aesthetic procedures across the beauty industry have become increasingly popular in recent years, with treatments like hair removal becoming the norm. Several influences have been behind the growing spending on hair removal services. Rising incomes have given consumers more flexibility to keep routine beauty treatment in their routines, while social media's influence on consumers' beauty standards has brought more people to explore hair removal procedures.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Operating Challenges Keep Hair Removal Studios From Recouping Profit
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While the increasing number of consumers seeking beauty procedures has encouraged more hair removal studios to join the industry, it's created a more crowded space. More medical spas, dermatology providers, and hair salons have expanded their services to take advantage of escalating spending, adding to competitive pressures. An uptick in the volume of laser hair treatments has also introduced regulatory scrutiny surrounding its safety.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growth was significantly affected by the pandemic.
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Closures and health concerns kept clients from receiving personal care services, introducing unprecedented financial and operational challenges for hair removal studios. Still, deferred appointments and a renewed interest in revamping beauty routines after long periods at home caused spending on hair removal to skyrocket in 2021. Pent-up demand for travel and events like weddings – common events for which consumers receive hair removal – also contributed to the sales spike.

An exodus of beauty professionals following the pandemic shrunk the supply of employees. Long-lasting disruptions to the labor market continue to appear in the industry, with hiring challenges ballooning wage expenses to a record high in 2024. Persistent staffing challenges, higher living costs, and the resumption of student loan payments in late 2023 will subdue spending on pricier hair removal treatments, like laser, in 2024. A more saturated hair removal space and a spending slowdown will constrain profit growth.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumer spending influences how much consumers decide to spend on personal care routines. When spending rises, consumers will likely spend on discretionary care like hair removal. As spending falls, consumers look for lower-cost alternatives or forego care entirely. Declining consumer spending represents a potential threat to the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Hiring challenges and supply chain snags
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Hiring challenges and supply chain snags made it challenging for hair removal studios to recoup profit losses.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Inflation driving labor and supply costs up
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Inflation driving labor and supply costs up has kept profit down through 2023, even as some hair studios passed down the additional costs by charging higher prices.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Staffing Issues Pressure Hair Removal Studios to Raise Wages
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Hiring challenges across the personal care space will push payroll expenses to a record high in 2024. During the first wave of the pandemic, an exodus of personal care employees shrunk the pool of employees, with hair removal studios continuing to grapple with this nearly four years later.
External employment trends and inflation have also driven up the cost for employees.

Some hair removal professionals are required by law to have advanced training, although exact regulations vary by state. Hair removal studios operating in states – like New Jersey and New York – requiring medical professionals to perform laser procedures will pay more in wage expenses.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Discretionary services are vulnerable to volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Hair removal is a discretionary personal care service. Being considered a nonessential service exposes hair removal companies to volatility, as consumers will reduce spending when incomes or consumer behavior changes.

Various other personal care businesses – spas, hair and nail salons – also offer hair removal, making the industry susceptible to competitive pressures. At-home alternatives also give consumers an affordable option to cut back on spending.

External events also introduce volatility. Health concerns kept people away from personal care businesses during the pandemic, while deferred appointments created unprecedented demand as worries lifted.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: New hair removal technologies deliver safer procedures and better results
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Hair removal methods have advanced from waxing and threading to more advanced techniques like laser hair removal and epilation. Now, advances in laser procedures are delivering safer, faster and more efficient options for clients.

A commonly cited reason people avoid laser hair removal is the pain and discomfort associated with the procedure. New cooling systems can mitigate a patient's discomfort, giving hair removal studios offering this equipment an advantage.

Advances in lasers have also made laser hair removal possible for people with darker skin tones; previous lasers couldn't distinguish between hair pigment and skin color. Adopting this new technology allows studios to provide services to a broader range of clients.
